story:
Once upon a time in the bustling city of Baghdad, there lived a young girl named Leila. She was a kind and curious child with big dreams and an even bigger heart. Every night before bed, Leila's mother would tuck her in and tell her stories of the magical world outside their window.

One evening, as the stars twinkled in the night sky, Leila's mother began her tale. "Once upon a time, in a faraway land, there was a beautiful garden filled with the most vibrant flowers and singing birds. The garden was so enchanting that people would travel from all over the world just to catch a glimpse of its beauty."

Leila listened intently, her eyes wide with wonder. "And in this magical garden," her mother continued, "lived a wise old owl who watched over all the creatures. The owl was known for his wisdom and kindness, always ready to offer advice to those in need."

As her mother spoke, Leila imagined herself walking through the garden, surrounded by colorful blooms and the gentle rustling of leaves. She could almost hear the melodious songs of the birds and feel the soft touch of the petals against her skin.

"And so, every night before she went to bed, the little girl would close her eyes and imagine herself in the magical garden, surrounded by love and beauty," her mother said with a smile. "And she would drift off to sleep, carried away by the sweet lullaby of the night."

With a peaceful smile on her face, Leila snuggled under her covers, her heart full of joy and her mind filled with dreams of the magical garden. As she closed her eyes, she could almost hear the soft hooting of the wise old owl, watching over her as she drifted off into a world of enchantment and wonder.

And so, in the quiet of the night, Leila fell asleep, wrapped in the warmth of her mother's love and the magic of her imagination. The stars above twinkled brightly, whispering tales of adventure and beauty, as the city of Baghdad settled into a peaceful slumber, ready to greet the dawn of a new day.
